page.title: 03LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The area consists of undulating farmland and woods averaging one hundred feet above sea level. Because of the introduction of the wool trade in the area in medieaval times there are an abundance of large houses and churches, very few thatched cottages remain, but there are many flint buildings. Of particular note are GREEN FARM, THORPE MARKET, which possesses fine Elizabethan chimneys, CHURCH FARMHOUSE, SOUTHREPPS, a fine example of both "knapped" and "galloted" flintwork. The church itself was originally built in the l3th century, has the second highest tower in North Norfolk, rising to ll4 feet, and was repointed in 1983 to preserve the flintwork. JOHN O' GAUNTS HALL, GIMINGHAM, was originally built in the l5 century, rebuilt around 1650 a JACOBEAN thatched and flint cottage.
